author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hi all, now a question regarding to https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-4895-beacon-chain-withdrawals-as-system-level-operations/8568

We have had a "add COINBASE to warm addresses" EIP which is CFI for Shanghai. Follow-up question:
Do we want that the withdrawal addresses are considered warm as well? ðŸ™‚ CC <@539495253418180618> <@291925846556540928>

author: jgm
content: Withdrawals are not standard transactions, so have 0 gas usage and do not trigger smart contract operation.  Given that, is there any benefit in making this a warm address?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yes, because we will need to load it from IO (same as loading coinbase) so in the end of the block it will be warm (i.e. loaded). We have to update it's state (nonzero value transfer), so we can mark it as warm, since we already know it should be loaded and updated

author: jochembrouwer
content: Same reason why coinbase is "supposed" to be warm

author: jochembrouwer
content: Note: "mining" / PoS value transfers are also "not standard transactions", but we have to update coinbase, so we can consider the address to be warm

author: jochembrouwer
content: Note: since it is known these addresses will be loaded, any CALL/BALANCE, (etc.) opcodes regarding these accounts will be overpriced if they are considered cold

author: jochembrouwer
content: Will need a security validation of that ^ statement though ðŸ™‚

author: chfast
content: withdrawals are applied after all transactions so warm address does not matter.
